title: 105_hr209
content: The Act titled "Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 1997" designates income tax payments to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Individuals with an adjusted income tax liability of $5 or more can designate $5 to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund. For joint filers with a liability of $10 or more, each spouse can also designate $5 to the fund. Adjusted income tax liability is the excess of income tax liability over any amount previously designated by the individual or spouse. Individuals can designate $5 to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund if their adjusted income tax liability is $5 or more. Joint filers with a liability of $10 or more can also designate $5 each. The designation can be made when filing the tax return or at a later time specified by regulations. The designation must be made as prescribed by the Secretary, either on the first page of the return or on the page with the taxpayer's signature. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund allows individuals to designate $5 from their tax liability. Joint filers can also designate $5 each if their liability is $10 or more. Designation can be done when filing taxes or later as per regulations. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund allows individuals to designate $5 from their tax liability, with joint filers able to designate $5 each if their liability is $10 or more. Designation can be done when filing taxes or later as per regulations. SEC. 9512 establishes the fund. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund is created in the Treasury of the United States, funded by appropriations and transfers designated under section 6098. The fund is available for making qualified research grants, supplementing existing funding. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund will provide qualified research grants for research on breast and prostate cancer, administered by the National Cancer Institute. Grants will be determined through qualified peer review processes. Amendments are made to the table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Code. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund is designated for research grants, administered by the National Cancer Institute. A new section, Sec. 9512, is added to the table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1996.
